title: [BUG] The dim of empty tensor is one in PyTorch 0.4.0
body_html:
Issue description

The dim of empty tensor was 0 in version 0.3.0, but I got 1 in version 0.4.0

Code example

In [1]: x = torch.Tensor([])

In [2]: x
Out[2]: tensor([])

In [3]: x.dim()
Out[3]: 1

In [4]: x = torch.Tensor([1])

In [5]: x
Out[5]: tensor([ 1.])

In [6]: x.dim()
Out[6]: 1
  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip install torch
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • OS: Mac OS 10.12.6
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0
  • Python version: 3.6.1

body:
## Issue description
The dim of empty tensor was 0 in version 0.3.0, but I got 1 in version 0.4.0

## Code example

```
In [1]: x = torch.Tensor([])

In [2]: x
Out[2]: tensor([])

In [3]: x.dim()
Out[3]: 1

In [4]: x = torch.Tensor([1])

In [5]: x
Out[5]: tensor([ 1.])

In [6]: x.dim()
Out[6]: 1
```

- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip install torch
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
- OS: Mac OS 10.12.6
- PyTorch version: 0.4.0
- Python version: 3.6.1
